channel.title: Where to buy a Axoloti Core
channel.description: Hi, i just heard about the Axoloti today but could not figure out where to buy one. Any link or info is greatly appreciated. Thanks a lot.

item.title: Where to buy a Axoloti Core
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

perhaps contact these guys and tell them you want them to stock axoloti

another idea, you could try to organise a 'group buy' on somewhere like muffwigglers, that way you can perhaps save something on the shipping.
... of course, the guy organising the 'group buy' has some risk...and Im assuming Johannes might be able to get a slightly better deal on shipping for N axoloti in a single box.

(you could try to organise here, but you'll get more 'views' on MW/KVR etc)

Read full topic

item.description:
@Olivier wrote:

That's too bad. Feels that this should be a perfect product for Analogue Haven or Perfect Circuit Audio ( both of which are, selfishly for me, located in Los Angeles )

( I ended up getting mine as a full Axo-Control kit from Thonk, definitely worth the price ). I think this is the best Audio/Synth DIY platform by far.

item.title: Where to buy a Axoloti Core
item.dc:creator: @SirPrimalform
item.description:
@SirPrimalform wrote:

Aha, found the thread that I was thinking of:

http://mutable-instruments.net/forum/discussion/comment/124692#Comment_124692

It was a Behringer interface and what I said was actually just what Olivier (pichenettes) hypothesised rather than a definite explanation. I just wanted to make sure that the ADC/DACs using in the Core had proper support for 48kHz.

I'm looking forward to my board arriving! I'm sure I'll try processing my Shruthi at some point, so I'll report back.

Read full topic
item.source: Where to buy a Axoloti Core

item.title: Where to buy a Axoloti Core
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

The ADC/DAC anti-aliasing and reconstruction filters follow the configured sample rate.
http://www.analog.com/media/en/technical-documentation/data-sheets/ADAU1361.pdf

Which audio interface is throwing away every other sample?

Read full topic
item.source: Where to buy a Axoloti Core

item.title: Where to buy a Axoloti Core
item.dc:creator: @SirPrimalform
item.description:
@SirPrimalform wrote:

In my experience most 24/96kHz capable ADC/DAC's sound good at lower sample rates too.

Sorry for the necro, but doesn't this depend on whether the anti-aliasing/reconstruction filters follow the sample rate change? Nyquist for 96kHz is obviously 48kHz, so if the ADC doesn't properly support a 48kHz mode and is effectively sampling at 96kHz and then throwing away every other sample then stuff above 24kHz will alias. Obviously that is above the range of human hearing, but obviously stuff above that can alias down into range of our hearing. There was a problem someone was having on the Mutable Instruments forums where their audio interface didn't have proper anti-aliasing filters when running at 48kHz instead of 96kHz and the ~39kHz PWM carrier frequency from their Shruthi was aliasing (39-24=15, 24-15= 9kHz which is definitely audible).

I'm just curious, did you account for that sort of stuff in your design when you elected to use 96kHz running at 48kHz?

Read full topic

item.source: Where to buy a Axoloti Core

item.title: Where to buy a Axoloti Core
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

Axoloti Core is using a 24/96 capable audio converter at 24/48, it is not an upgrade. The only reason 24/96 is not exposed as an option is that it takes quite some work on the editor, firmware and objects to allow multiple sample rates, and patches may not sound the same at different sample rates.
So it says "24bit/96kHz capable stereo audio ADC/DAC", technically correct for the hardware spec, but maybe misleading. I added "(editor and firmware currently only supports 24bit/48kHz)" to it.

In my experience most 24/96kHz capable ADC/DAC's sound good at lower sample rates too.

Read full topic
item.source: Where to buy a Axoloti Core

item.title: Where to buy a Axoloti Core
item.dc:creator: @AdrianWillaert
item.description:
@AdrianWillaert wrote:

I remember that the axoloti sold during kickstarter was
16bit / 48kHz but now on the product specs I read 24 bit / 96kHz

is this an upgrade or am I wrong?

Thanks!

Read full topic
item.source: Where to buy a Axoloti Core

item.title: Where to buy a Axoloti Core
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

BPost does not have a state/province field in their shipping label creation backend. But it's all right, tracking has shown that parcels dispatch to different sorting centers in the US from Belgium, depending on the zipcode.

Read full topic
item.source: Where to buy a Axoloti Core

item.title: Where to buy a Axoloti Core
item.dc:creator: @DazzlingDuke Daniel D Lindmark
item.description:
@DazzlingDuke wrote:

Hello Johannes, I love the product! I just bought two cores! You asked for feedback, so I wanted to let you know that the order form doesn't ask for the state (province) if you select United States. I included my full address in the comments, but you might not be able to ship another package to the US if they don't include the state. You can infer it from the zip-code, however, so maybe it's alright.

Regardless, top notch system integration.

Read full topic
